body_html: This is the code I'm using. This is used in a class called MaskedTensor that also holds indices and values. I re-implemented it because with sparse Tensor, I run into cases where the indices would be re-arranged, and this invalidated another function I had to differentiate sparse Tensor construction wrt to the input values.
body_text: This is the code I'm using. This is used in a class called MaskedTensor that also holds indices and values. I re-implemented it because with sparse Tensor, I run into cases where the indices would be re-arranged, and this invalidated another function I had to differentiate sparse Tensor construction wrt to the input values.
body: [This](https://github.com/ds4dm/sparse-gcn/blob/801bb5fc3290ba64376416765e5b0b6c45b9a330/sgcn/masked/functions.py#L112) is the code I'm using. This is used in a class called `MaskedTensor` that also holds `indices` and `values`. I re-implemented it because with sparse `Tensor`, I run into cases where the indices would be re-arranged, and this invalidated another function I had to differentiate sparse `Tensor` construction wrt to the input values.
